means: 捆缚（马等）之两腿（以防走失）

sentence.Network_en: The swelling had begun to go down, and he was able, with pain, to hobble.
sentence.Network_cn: 肿胀已经开始消退，他能忍着痛一瘸一拐地走了。

sentence.Network_en: He was left with no alternative but to hobble to the nearest telephone box.
sentence.Network_cn: 他别无他法,只能一瘸一拐地走到最近的电话亭.

sentence.Network_en: Now, here it is: What could I do, with this old timber I hobble on?
sentence.Network_cn: 你瞧, 我拄着这木拐杖还能怎么样 呢 ?

无题 ... dribble n.v. 细流;滴落 hobble v. 蹒跚，跛行;不流畅 nibble v.n. 细嚼慢咽，轻咬，蚕食.

可口可乐曲线瓶(Hobbleskirt)是由Alexander Samuelson在1915年发明的1917年罗伯特·沃特森·瓦特发明世界第一台雷达1917年美国 …

The old lady hobbled down the stairs to greet us ., 这位老太太蹒跚的下楼迎接我们.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: probably of Dutch or Low German origin and related to Dutch hobbelen 'rock from side to side'

entry.def: If you hobble, you walk in an awkward way with small steps, for example because your foot is injured.

example.ex: He got up slowly and hobbled over to the coffee table...
example.tran: 他慢慢地站起来，一瘸一拐地走到咖啡桌旁。

example.ex: The swelling had begun to go down, and he was able, with pain, to hobble.
example.tran: 肿胀已经开始消退，他能忍着痛一瘸一拐地走了。

entry.def: To hobble something or someone means to make it more difficult for them to be successful or to achieve what they want.

example.ex: The poverty of 10 million citizens not only demeans our society but its cost also hobbles our economy.
example.tran: 1,000万的贫困人口不仅给我们的社会抹黑，而且在这上面的支出也阻碍了我们的经济发展。

means.word_mean: 1. a shackle for the ankles or feet
2. the uneven manner of walking that results from an injured leg
1. walk impeded by some physical limitation or injury;

sentences.sentence: "The old woman hobbles down to the store every day"

means.word_mean: 2. hamper the action or progress of;

sentences.sentence: "The chairman was hobbled by the all-powerful dean"

means.word_mean: 3. strap the foreleg and hind leg together on each side (of a horse) in order to keep the like-sided legs moving in unison;

auth_sentence.content: The surplus had to hobble to Da guan city.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: The surplus had to hobble to Da guan city.

auth_sentence.content: Continued high energy prices will hobble any economic recovery.
auth_sentence.res_content: Continued high energy prices will hobble any economic recovery.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Continued high energy prices will hobble any economic recovery.

auth_sentence.content: We watched him hobble off to snap pictures of the warehouse.
auth_sentence.res_content: We watched him hobble off to snap pictures of the warehouse.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: We watched him hobble off to snap pictures of the warehouse.

means.word_mean: 跛行;蹒跚;一瘸一拐地走

sentences.en: I hurt my foot, and had to hobble home.
sentences.cn: 我把脚弄伤了, 只得一瘸一拐地走回家。

sentences.en: He was left with no alternative but to hobble to the nearest telephone box.
sentences.cn: 他别无他法，只能一瘸一拐地走到最近的电话亭。
